gpt-4.1-nano-2025-04-14.patternDescription: The pattern seems to involve moving the smallest value in each row to the front (first position), the largest to the end (last position), and keeping the middle value where it is. This resembles a partial sorting or rearrangement based on the values, but it might not always be consistent for every set. Caution: this pattern might not hold for all examples, especially if the data changes or if other transformations are involved.
gpt-4.1-nano-2025-04-14.solvingStrategy: First, translate the emoji numbers into their numeric equivalents (0-9). Then, for each row, identify the smallest and largest numbers. Place the smallest at the beginning of the row, the largest at the end, and keep the middle number where it is. If you want, you can think of this as 'sorting' the row so that the smallest is first and the biggest is last. Remember, this is a hypothesis — the pattern may have exceptions, so check if it fits all cases. Be cautious: if the numbers are very similar or if the pattern changes, this approach might fail.
